page.title: 08CHURCH STRETTON GEOLOGY
page.content: Some of the oldest rocks in the country lie around Church Stretton. They were formed from a period between {800 and 900 million years ago.}Most hills are of different types of rock. Church Stretton lies in a valley between the hills of the Long Mynd, Caer Caradoc, The Lawley, Helmeth, Hazler and Ragleth. The valley follows a big fault called The Church Stretton Fault. Some hills like the Caradoc and Ragleth are the oldest rock in the valley. They were formed by lava. But neither of these hills was a volcano. They are made of rocks and ashes. The Long Mynd is mainly sedimentary rock consisting mainly of shales and sandstones.
